ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The fieldtrip was very useful but the Teaching assistant was hoorible and was very authorotative and spoilt the entire trip by constantly hanging out with her own friends and creating a click group. She was constantly very irritant and talked about the rest of the students beahvior among her click group. My entire fieldtrip, I couldnt help but feel like I was in Hign School and I ended up crying. I couldn't help but feel that I paid to expereince such pain. However, some of the students were vey considerate and helpful.The instructor was clearly doing all the work while the teaching assistant was "hanging out" with her friends. The entire while I kept asking why did the school give the opportunity to a student who clearly didnt require the financial support and who didn't appreciate it.

I thought Mike did an incredible job organizing and facilitating the trip. He was always incredibly responsive to studentquestions and put a lot of energy and focus into making sure everyone had access to all the information. I thoroughly enjoyed the experience and learned a lot.

Absolutely great class/ fieldtrip- Mike was an excellent instructor. Logistics were a bit crazy and Miketended to get VERY stressed which reflected poorly on the group and our visitors. Needs two instructors.
field trip was great

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: It was amazing to meet Yale Alums and see various aspects of forestry in the field. the south is entirely differnt from the North East. It changed my entire perspective on forestry.
The field trips were diverse (in terms of landowner type) and everything was very well organized.
Site visits
Seeing how forestry works in practice was invaluable.

It was awesome. Having field time, particularly with a guide like Mike, was hugely beneficial in understanding industrial forestry and the ecosystems of the southeast. I learned a ton. Perhaps more in this one week than in most term-length courses. More trips like this should be at FES. All students should take at least one such course during their time here.
observing field operations, studying a new ecosystem
The diversity/variety of actors/entities visited was great.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Teaching Assistant has to be a genuine student who is willing to be there for her fellow students and be a bridge between the instructor and the student.He/She should be there to make things easier not difficult. Not the opposite.
I don't have any feedback for how it could have been improved except for maybe not quite so much travel from site to site.
Logistics
Not much. Mike and Ann did a wonderful job planning the trip.

too many field trips and too much rushing - would have been better if we could gain a little more depth at some of the sites - I recommend 1/2 day visits (and no 1-2 hour visits). 1-2 hour visits make the hosts uncomfortable
Lengthen the trip to add more free time.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Discussions were good- could have used a few more.
We only had the chance on one evening, I think, to do a real debrief from the day. I thought it was really valuable and would like to see debriefs happen most days.
na

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: The fieldtrip gave me a perspective of the south that I had just imagined from the classes I took.
I wanted more time out in the field and had heard excellent things about the course. I'm also really interested in forestry issues in the southern U.S.
good field contribution to forestry education

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To give me a better perspective of Southern Forestry.
same reason as above.
Good fit and filled some gaps in my forestry knowledge base.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes! It was a great way to integrate a lot of the other courses I'd taken.
Yup
Oh yes.
Exceeded them. Just a week chocked full of learning.
yes
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: take it!
Be prepared for a really fullweek!
Absolutely go- it's an awesome trip.
good field tripp
Absolutely go!!
